<topcClas>Social attitudes and behaviour - Society and culture</topcClas>         <topcClas>Ethnic minorities - Social stratification and groupings</topcClas>         <topcClas>Social indicators and quality of life - Society and culture</topcClas>       </subject>       <abstract><p>Abstract copyright UK Data Service and data collection copyright owner.</p>This study was the fourth in a series of national surveys of ethnic minorities.  The main objectives were:<ul><li>to describe the social and economic conditions of Britain's main ethnic minority groups, including their health, and to compare these with the social and economic conditions of the white majority</li><li>to assess changes over time through comparisons with other work</li><li>to show how the position of ethnic minority groups is related to the social and ethnic compositions of the areas in which they live</li><li>to explore diversity among different ethnic minority groups</li><li>to describe perceptions and experience of racial discrimination and social harassment</li></ul></abstract>       <abstract><B>Main Topics</B>:<br>Topics covered include household structure, neighbourhoods and quality of housing, education, employment, health, racial harassment and discrimination, and ethnic identity.<br> </abstract>       <sumDscr>         <collDate event="start" date="1993-11-01T00:00:00Z">November 1993</collDate>         <collDate event="end" date="1994-12-01T00:00:00Z">December 1994</collDate>         <nation>England and Wales</nation>         <geogUnit>Standard Statistical Regions</geogUnit>         <geogUnit>Wards (Electoral)</geogUnit>         <anlyUnit>Individuals</anlyUnit>         <universe>National</universe>         <universe>Adults</universe>         <universe>Minority groups</universe>         <universe>Adults aged 16 years and over who have Caribbean, Indian, Pakistani, Bangladeshi or Chinese family origins, and also a white comparison sample.</universe>       </sumDscr>     </stdyInfo>     <method>       <dataColl>         <timeMeth>Repeated cross-sectional study</timeMeth>         <timeMeth>Fourth in a series carried out every 10 years.</timeMeth>         <dataCollector>Social and Community Planning Research</dataCollector>         <sampProc>Multi-stage stratified random sample</sampProc>         <sampProc>1991 Census material was added to the dataset.</sampProc>         <deviat>Ethnic minority: 5,400 (target), 5,196 (obtained).  White: 2,500 (target), 2,867 (obtained).</deviat>         <collMode>Face-to-face interview; Compilation or synthesis of existing material</collMode>         <sources>           <dataSrc>A partial transcription of 1991 Census data was used for sample design.</dataSrc>         </sources>         <ConOps>Structure checks and consistency/plausibility checks.</ConOps>         <weight>Weighting used. See documentation for details.</weight>         <cleanOps>B</cleanOps>       </dataColl>     </method>     <dataAccs>       <setAvail>         <accsPlac>UK Data Service</accsPlac>       </setAvail>       <useStmt>         <specPerm>Standard conditions of access</specPerm>         <restrctn>The depositor has specified that registration is required and standard conditions of use apply.
